data.title: THEODOROS "THEO" ANGELOPOULOS
data.text:
The Broadcast (1968): Critics’ Prize, Thessaloniki Film Festival

Reconstruction (1970): Best Director, Thessaloniki Film Festival (1971); Best Cinematography, Thessaloniki Film Festival (1971); Best Film, Thessaloniki Film Festival (1971); Best Actress, Thessaloniki Film Festival (1971); Critics’ Prize, Thessaloniki Film Festival (1971); Best Foreign Film, Hyeres Film Festival (1971); Georges Sadoul Award (1971); Special Mention, FIPRESCI (Fédération Internationale de la Presse Cinématographique), Berlin (1971)

Days of ’36 (1972): Best Picture Award and Photography at the Thessaloniki Film Festival; Best Picture Award from FIPRESCI (International Federation of Film Critics) at Berlin’s Forum.

The Travelling Players (1975): Directors’ Fortnight, Cannes (1975); FIPRESCI Grand Prix, Cannes (1975); Interfilm Award Berlin «Forum» (1975); Best Film of the year, Golden Age Award, Brussels (1976); Best Film of the Year, British Film Institute (1976); Best Film, Thessaloniki Film Festival; Grand Prix of the Arts, Japan; Best Film of the Year, Japan

Best Film in the World 1970-1980; Italian Critics’ Association

FIPRESCI 40th Best Film in the History of Cinema

The Hunters (1977): Official Selection, Cannes (1977); Golden Hugo Award, Chicago Film Festival (1978)

Alexander the Great (1980): Gold Lion, Venice Film Festival (1980); FIPRESCI Award, Venice Film Festival (1980); New Cinema Award, Venice Film Festival (1980)

Landscape in the Mist (1988): Silver Lion, Best Director, Venice (1988); FIPRESCI, Venice, (1988); CICAE Art House Prize (1988); Pasinetti Award (1988); Golden Hugo Award, Chicago Film Festival (1988); Silver Plaque for Best Cinematography, Chicago Film Festival (1988); Felix Award, Best European Film of the Year (1989)

Ulysses’ Gaze (1995): Grand Prix, Cannes (1995); FIPRESCI Award, Cannes (1995); Felix Award, Best European Film of the Year (1995)

Eternity and a day (1998): Gold Palm Award, Cannes (1998); Ecumenical Prize, Cannes (1998)

TRILOGY: The Weeping Meadow: Official Selection, Berlin Film Festival (2004); FIPRESCI Prize, European Film Award of the Critics (2004); Chicago International Film Festival, Special Presentation (2004); Valladolid International Film Festival, Official Selection (2004)

1985: Chevalier de l’Ordre des Arts et des Lettres, by the Cultural Ministry of France

1992: Chevalier de la Légion d’Honneur, by the President of the French Republic

1995: Docteur Honoris Causa, from «L’ Université Libre de Bruxelles», Belgium

1996: Officier de l’Ordre des Arts et des Lettres, Centre National de la Cinématographie,

1999: Officier de la Légion d’ Honneur, by the President of the French Republic Department of Arts and Letters, France

2001: Docteur Honoris Causa, from the University of Essex, England

2004: Docteur Honoris Causa, from “L’Universite Stendhal-Grenoble3”, France

2005: Grande Officiale dell'Ordine al Merito della Reppublica Italiana, Italy

2007: Docteur Honoris Causa, from the University of Sheffield, England

2008: Docteur Honoris Causa, from “ Universita di Roma”, Italy

2009: Docteur Honoris Causa, from “ University of the Aegean”, Greece

2010: Docteur Honoris Causa, from “University of Ismir”, Turkey

After his passing, in 2012, the Ministry of Culture and Tourism and the Thessaloniki Film Festival established the International Award “Theodoros Angelopoulos” in his honour.
